#Text=Become a Book Lover
#Text=People often say they do n't like to read books , and only do so because of work or school .
#Text=But reading provides opportunities to grow , expand your horizons , and even improve your health .
#Text=If you would like to reap the benefits of reading but do n't know where to start , here are a few ideas .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Overcoming Obstacles to Reading
#Text=Address reading difficulties .

#Text=Whether you have a learning disability such as dyslexia , never learned to read , or view reading as something to be endured rather than enjoyed , there are steps you can take to make reading an enjoyable experience .
#Text=Find an adult literacy program .
#Text=Contact your local school district or public library to see if they offer literacy programs .
#Text=If they do n't , ProLiteracy.org , a worldwide adult literacy organization has a directory of literacy programs throughout the United States .
#Text=Find a literary style you enjoy reading .
#Text=You do n't need to read long novels or thick textbooks .
#Text=You can read poetry , short stories , graphic novels , or any written format .
#Text=Listen to audio books .
#Text=Want to enjoy a book but do n't have the time ?
#Text=Listen to it on audio !
#Text=Studies show listening to audio books has benefits that reading does not provide , like the ability to multitask while listening to a book .
#Text=Read with an open mind .
#Text=Books are entertaining , thought provoking , and educational .
#Text=You may have to challenge yourself to read more , thinking that reading is a waste of time .
#Text=But if you are willing to put in some extra effort , you will find reading provides many benefits , including fun .
#Text=Set aside time for reading .
#Text=Pick a book that interests you and read for a set amount of time .
#Text=It can be as short or as long a time as you want .
#Text=Get through a book you do n't enjoy .
#Text=Sometimes you have required reading you ca n't avoid .
#Text=Here are some tips to read material that does n't pique your interest :
#Text=Divide your reading into manageable sections .
#Text=When reading a textbook in particular , there are some steps that can help :
#Text=Read from the end to the beginning .
#Text=If have to read a textbook , skip to the questions at the end of the chapter .
#Text=Then go back to the beginning and find the answers to the questions .
#Text=Find the main ideas .
#Text=Look at the headings and subsections to get an overview of the chapter .
#Text=This will make it easier to get through the mountain of information .
#Text=Take notes .
#Text=Not only will this help you remember what you are reading , it will give you something to refer to after you have finished the assignment .
#Text=Put the book down .
#Text=If you 're reading a book you do n't enjoy , go ahead and put it down if it 's not required reading .
#Text=You can always come back to it later .
#Text=Selecting Reading Material
#Text=Choose a literary style that interests you .
#Text=There are any number of genres available .
#Text=Whether you prefer mysteries , non-fiction , or any other type of literature , you can find a book to suit your taste .
#Text=The challenge may be to narrow down your choices .
#Text=You may want to :
#Text=Check out the cover .
#Text=If the title or artwork looks interesting , check the inside for information such as a content summary , review excerpts , and information about the author .
#Text=Find book summaries online .
#Text=There are many websites providing summaries of books you may be interested in reading .
#Text=The Power Moves and Softonics.com are two sites reviewing the best summary websites .
#Text=Read with friends .
#Text=Joining a discussion club can introduce you to books you would n't otherwise know about , and provide insights on what you have read .
#Text=There are a number of benefits to being in a reading club :
#Text=It gives you an incentive to finish .
#Text=Having a deadline may give you the push you need to finish the book .
#Text=It can decrease stress .
#Text=You can express your opinions freely to a group with common interests .
#Text=It can improve your writing skills .
#Text=Reading and discussing the writing styles of different authors can provide ideas you may want to incorporate in your own writing .
#Text=Select your preferred format .
#Text=Whether you prefer print or digital , there is a format to suit every reader .
#Text=Read with an e-reader .
#Text=When you have time to read but do n't want to carry a book around , e-readers like Kindle or Nook can be a virtual library of reading material .
#Text=Depending on the available features , e-readers cost between $ 75 and $ 250 .
#Text=Online review sites like PCMag.com and Cnet.com can help you find the best e-reader for your use .
#Text=Read a traditional print book .
#Text=Despite the conveniences of an e-book , print books do have some advantages .
#Text=Books provide a multi-sensory experience that e-readers do n't .
#Text=Studies have shown that people retain more when reading in print due to having more than one sense involved .
#Text=It is easier to keep your place in a print book .
#Text=Many e-books do not have a way to get back to a previously viewed page .
#Text=Go to the library .
#Text=You 'll find a wealth of information on a variety of topics in a number of formats .
#Text=And much of it 's for free !
#Text=Reaping the Benefits of Reading
#Text=Read to improve wellbeing .
#Text=It has been scientifically proven that people who cultivate a reading habit become happier and healthier than non-readers .
#Text=The benefits of reading include :
#Text=Increased longevity .
#Text=According to a 2016 study , reading 3.5 hours or more resulted in a 20 % increase in life expectancy as compared to non-readers .
#Text=Reduced stress .
#Text=Reading has been shown to be effective at reducing stress levels along with such healthful activities as listening to music , drinking tea or coffee , or walking .
#Text=Improved relaxation and sleep .
#Text=The relaxation that comes with reading makes it a perfect way to get ready for sleep .
#Text=Experts recommend reading a print book rather than an e-book , and the subject matter should be conducive to relaxation .
#Text=Improved memory .
#Text=Studies have shown that people who read experience a slower decline in memory later in life than non-readers .
#Text=Reading is a mental work-out .
#Text=Reading a book encourages " deep thinking , " or thinking critically and making connections to each page as well as the outside word .
#Text=This results in the brain creating neural networks that can promote quicker thinking and improved cognitive skills .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you like to watch movies , there are any number of books that also have a movie tie-in .
#Text=Diary of a Wimpy Kid is one example of a young adult book that was adapted into a movie .
#Text=While reading , try to visualize what is going on .
